allergy.recommendations: Avoid allergens and ventilate the room regularly.
allergy.self_care: Take antihistamines if needed and rinse your nose with saline solution.
allergy.reasonForDoctorVisit: If you experience severe swelling, widespread rash, or difficulty breathing.

arthritis.recommendations: Reduce stress on the joints and perform light exercises.
arthritis.self_care: Use anti-inflammatory creams, apply warm compresses, and take painkillers as directed.
arthritis.reasonForDoctorVisit: If pain and swelling persist for several days or worsen.

bronchial asthma.recommendations: Avoid triggers and keep your inhaler handy.
bronchial asthma.self_care: Practice breathing control and perform gentle breathing exercises.
bronchial asthma.reasonForDoctorVisit: If attacks become more frequent or your inhaler is not effective.

cervical spondylosis.recommendations: Avoid sudden neck movements and do specialized neck exercises.
cervical spondylosis.self_care: Massage the neck area and apply warm compresses.
cervical spondylosis.reasonForDoctorVisit: If pain worsens or you develop arm numbness or dizziness.

chicken pox.recommendations: Stay in bed rest and treat marks gently.
chicken pox.self_care: Take antihistamines to reduce itching and apply antiseptics.
chicken pox.reasonForDoctorVisit: If complications arise, fever is high, or lesions become infected.

common cold.recommendations: Rest, drink plenty of warm fluids, and stay warm.
common cold.self_care: Use fever reducers like paracetamol and nasal decongestant drops.
common cold.reasonForDoctorVisit: If fever lasts more than 3 days or symptoms worsen.

dengue.self_care: Take fever reducers (avoid aspirin) and rest.
dengue.reasonForDoctorVisit: If you experience severe abdominal pain, bleeding, or rapid deterioration.

diabetes.recommendations: Monitor blood sugar levels and follow a low-carb diet.
diabetes.self_care: Stay active regularly and consider glucose-lowering medications.
diabetes.reasonForDoctorVisit: If blood sugar is uncontrolled or you develop dizziness or vomiting.

drug reaction.self_care: For mild symptoms, observe and take antihistamines.
drug reaction.reasonForDoctorVisit: If you develop severe swelling, respiratory difficulty, or widespread rash.

fungal infection.recommendations: Keep affected areas dry and avoid skin injury.
fungal infection.self_care: Apply antifungal creams or ointments such as clotrimazole.
fungal infection.reasonForDoctorVisit: If infection spreads or does not respond to topical treatment.

gastroesophageal reflux disease.recommendations: Avoid eating before bedtime and reduce spicy/fatty foods.
gastroesophageal reflux disease.self_care: Use antacids or proton-pump inhibitors like omeprazole.
gastroesophageal reflux disease.reasonForDoctorVisit: If you have frequent heartburn or persistent chest pain.

hypertension.recommendations: Monitor your blood pressure, limit salt and caffeine intake.
hypertension.self_care: Practice relaxation exercises and drink calming herbal teas.
hypertension.reasonForDoctorVisit: If your blood pressure spikes suddenly or you get severe headaches or vision changes.

impetigo.recommendations: Disinfect lesions and maintain strict hygiene.
impetigo.self_care: Apply antiseptic ointments and avoid scratching.
impetigo.reasonForDoctorVisit: If the rash spreads or you develop fever.

jaundice.recommendations: Monitor liver function and avoid fatty foods.
jaundice.self_care: Drink plenty of water and follow a light diet.
jaundice.reasonForDoctorVisit: Urgently, for a full workup to identify the underlying cause.

malaria.recommendations: Seek immediate medical attention; this can be life-threatening.
malaria.self_care: Limited — specific antimalarial drugs are required.
malaria.reasonForDoctorVisit: Immediately — malaria requires prompt, specific treatment.

migraine.recommendations: Rest in a dark, quiet room and avoid stress.
migraine.self_care: Take painkillers such as ibuprofen or paracetamol as needed.
migraine.reasonForDoctorVisit: If headache lasts more than 3 days or is accompanied by nausea or vision problems.

peptic ulcer disease.recommendations: Avoid spicy foods, coffee, and alcohol.
peptic ulcer disease.self_care: Use antacids or PPIs like omeprazole to relieve pain.
peptic ulcer disease.reasonForDoctorVisit: If you experience severe pain, vomiting blood, or unexplained weight loss.

pneumonia.recommendations: Seek medical evaluation — antibiotics may be necessary.
pneumonia.self_care: Bed rest and plenty of fluids; self-treatment can be dangerous.

psoriasis.recommendations: Keep your skin moisturized and avoid irritants.
psoriasis.self_care: Use topical corticosteroids or soothing baths.
psoriasis.reasonForDoctorVisit: If lesions cover a large area or flare-ups worsen.

typhoid.recommendations: Follow a light diet and stay hydrated.
typhoid.self_care: Use only fever reducers; antibiotics are required for treatment.
typhoid.reasonForDoctorVisit: Immediately — typhoid is dangerous without antibiotic therapy.

urinary tract infection.recommendations: Drink plenty of fluids and don’t hold in urine.
urinary tract infection.self_care: Cranberry juice and warm sitz baths may help.
urinary tract infection.reasonForDoctorVisit: If pain increases or you notice blood in the urine.

varicose veins.recommendations: Avoid prolonged standing and wear compression stockings.
varicose veins.self_care: Massage and contrast baths for the legs.
varicose veins.reasonForDoctorVisit: If you experience severe swelling, pain, or the appearance of ulcers on the skin.
